title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 35.1 - Introduction
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 35.1 - Introduction

State Regulations

Articles 6, 7 and 8 of the Vehicle and Traffic Law require
that motorists be able to respond to damages arising out of the ownership, maintenance or use of a motor vehicle; and provide for the reporting of motor
vehicle liability insurance information, the monitoring of the status of
required insurance coverage and the imposition of penalties for having an
uninsured vehicle and operating an uninsured vehicle. This Part describes the
general rules governing DMV's issuance of a registrant inquiry letter, suspension and revocation order, compliance with and rescission of a suspension
and revocation order, restoration, payment of a civil penalty, acceptable proof
of compliance, and other related matters. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15
ยง
35.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
